title: Soon to be level 30 would like to start looking for a team also new with rank
body:
Hello. 

I'm currently level 28.5 and expect to be level 30 in less than a week.

Yes, I know what you're thinking, eh a level 28 he sucks. Well, during normal games I almost always carry as a mid laner. I'm also a good in any other position. I have also played against a gold player in mid lane and I beat him pretty thoroughly. 

I would just like to start searching for teams, I'm a good player and could make a good addition to any team, especially one needing a mid laner. 

Thank you for reading and for consideration.
I'd like to leave you with this, I think I can compete with anyone. I focus when I play and play to win and try my best. I also work to improve the best I can and learn from every single game.

replies.body: What everyone will tell you is "I thought I would be ready for Ranked when I hit level 30, boy was I wrong". Knowing that, don't rush into ranked. Just keep cranking out normal games, get your rune pages built up, etc. You'll probably be matched with harder opponents when you hit 30 anyway.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=K6EGEal2,discussion-id=tzPk9UV7,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-12-05T04:01:20.474+0000)
>
> What everyone will tell you is "I thought I would be ready for Ranked when I hit level 30, boy was I wrong". Knowing that, don't rush into ranked. Just keep cranking out normal games, get your rune pages built up, etc. You'll probably be matched with harder opponents when you hit 30 anyway.

I understand and agree you are probably right.
However, for me ranked games seem so boring and pointless.

I have the simple AD and AP rune pages, both full. But yes I agree more complex rune pages will be needed. I understand the importance of more than simple AD and AP, the importance of countering. But I'd like to get into more competitive play. I don't really care if I land in bronze, I will feel like I'm being productive while climbing whereas in normal games I feel like it's a grind simply towards more IP and Exp. I appreciate your comment, and I probably will regret it. :3

> [{quoted}](name=Kristian B 12,realm=NA,application-id=K6EGEal2,discussion-id=tzPk9UV7,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-12-05T04:18:58.394+0000)
>
> I don't really care if I land in bronze, I will feel like I'm being productive while climbing whereas in normal games I feel like it's a grind simply towards more IP and Exp.

How productive will you feel if you *don't* climb out of Bronze the entire season? Last year a friend of mine started Bronze 2 or so and fell to low Bronze 4. If something like that starts happening to you, where you get game after game where you're not progressing, what then?

I'm not trying to scare you off if that's how you think you'll enjoy the game most, just know that I've yet to come across anyone that said they were ready for ranked when they hit 30. 

Personally, I get the most out of this game when playing with friends, far more than playing ranked has ever given. I do look forward to the coming season, but mostly because I'll be able to play with more friend in Ranked.

I've been hovering in silver four from about 20 LP to 90 at times, although I haven't been able to steak enough games together to get back into silver 3.

One thing I've noticed in normal games, which often doesn't make it very fun, is that there are so many trolls and AFK's. Also, the level of competition from many opponents is very low. I decided I am going to main Middle and ADC, and when I'm in those two lanes I almost always win my lane, whether I can roam and beat the people my team probably already fed is another thing. But I want to at least do my preliminary matches and get a feel for what it is like.
I'm currently looking for Top, ADC, JG players who know one or two roles besides mid. Tell me if you're interested.
Hey my team needs a top laner if your interested message me please... Username: Kakuzo
